p:
From a comparison between the variation of the mean annual temperature
29 and our dendrochronological time-series (Fig. 8), we discovered that before 1978 the regional mean annual temperature remained below −4.3 °C. This threshold was, therefore, used to interpret the behavior of the hyperbolic curve (Fig. 8 upper-left panel) that emerged from the relationship between the mean annual growth and mean annual temperature (R 2 = 0.34). This curve, at about −4.3 °C can be divided in two linear regressions (<−4.3 °C negative, R 2 = 0.59; 4.3°C positive, R 2 = 0.39), which allow an easier estimation of the missing annual temperature records (before 1956 and after 2009) to fill the gap of the available data in the literature for the area. The only long temperature record
29 for the study-site covers a period between 1956 and 2009 and the most recent records (1966–2015)
31 are from close meteorological stations but situated at lower altitudes.
